entities.description: The specific time frame during which the survey data is collected.
The frequency of substance use within the specified survey period.
The type of substance used (e.g., tobacco, alcohol, drugs).
The mental health condition of the respondent during the survey period.
The type of treatment received for substance use or mental health issues.
The residential status of the respondent (rural or urban area).
The economic standing of the respondent (e.g., income level, employment status).

relationships.description: Indicates the period during which the survey is conducted.
Indicates the type of substance used by the respondent.
Indicates how frequently the respondent uses substances.
Indicates the mental health condition of the respondent.
Indicates the type of treatment the respondent received.
Indicates whether the respondent lives in a rural or urban area.
Indicates the economic status of the respondent.
